clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the BDNF-Val66Met Polymorphism in Alcohol-dependent Subjects in Relation to Abstinence After Withdrawal
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the BDNF- Val66Met Polymorphism in Alcohol-dependent Subjects in Relation to Abstinence After Withdrawal

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé
France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is complementary to the main study "Brain Derived Neurotrophic Factor Serum Levels Evolution During the Six Months After Alcohol Withdrawal " NCT01491347.
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the Bdnf gene - Val66Met polymorphism in subjects with alcohol dependence according to their alcohol consumption status 6 months after withdrawal (relapse or abstinence), in relation to the presence of psychiatric co-morbidities.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of the Bdnf gene Val/Val, Val/Met and Met/Met phenotypes as a function of relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: serum BDNF levels variations between inclusion and 6 months later (or 4 months if the participants does not come for the 4 months-follow-up).
existence of a psychiatric co-morbidity at the inclusion (major depression, schizophrenia, anxiety disorder)
presence of a psychiatric co-morbidity at 6 months after withdrawal (major depression, schizophrenia, anxiety disorder)

study_pop.textblock: alcohol-dependent subjects hospitalized for alcohol withdrawal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- participation to the study "BDNF serum levels evolution during 6 months after alcohol withdrawal" (main study)
- criteria from the main study
Exclusion Criteria:
- criteria from the main study
- released or out from the main study before the follow-up at 4 months after withdrawal
